page.title: 01AN OVERVIEW
page.content: {The Jarrow March, Catherine {Cookson, the Tyne Tunnel, and St. Bede are all names synonymous with this area of Tyneside, incorporating Jarrow and part of South Shields on the South bank of the Tyne and Howdon and Willington Quay on the North. Today, as in the 1930's, this area again faces high levels of unemployment, as the old order of employment in heavy engineering- industries, shipbuilding and ship- repairing, steadily decline. However, with new industries, housing redevelopment, the advent of the new{Tyneside Metro System,} new Community Centres and a new single site comprehensive school, the outlook for the future of the area is more promising than in the 30's.
